Description: Green glazed composition shabti of Horsiese with a lappet-wig, a summarily modelled face with a beard, crossed hands in low relief holding an incised hoe and the cord of an seed-basket which hangs over the shoulder; there is a column of incised Hieroglyphs running down the wide back pillar and a plinth beneath the feet.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
